intro: Nierembergia × atkinsiana, commonly known as the hybrid bellflower, is a perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Nierembergia × atkinsiana is relatively low maintenance and can be grown in USDA hardiness zones 6 to 9.
